questions.name: Review 1 (1)
questions.text: Provide the following information about the equation: <br=2><equation=y=-1/2(x-3)^2+2><br=2><lead=use format (min, max) for domain and range><br=1><lead=use -inf and inf to represent infinity>

questions.name: Review 1 (2)

questions.name: Review 2 (1)
questions.text: Write the equation of the quadratic function that has vertex (4 , -3) and passes through (6 , 1)

questions.name: Review 2 (2)
questions.text: Write the equation of the quadratic function that has range y ≤ 8 and has x intercepts -2 and 4

questions.name: Review 2 (3)
questions.text: Write the equation of the quadratic function that has range y ≥ -5 an axis of symmetry of x = 1 and has a y-intercept of -1

questions.name: Review 2 (4)
questions.text: Write the equation of the quadratic function that has x intercepts at -1 and 9 and passes through the point (-6 , -45)

questions.name: Review 2 (5)
questions.text: Write the equation of the quadratic function that passes through the points (-2 , 1) ,(8 , 1) ,(13 , 16)

questions.name: Review 3 (1)
questions.text: Complete the square:<br=1><equation=y=-3x^2+6x-8>

questions.name: Review 3 (2)
questions.text: Complete the square:<br=1><equation=y=1/2x^2-4x+3>

questions.name: Review 3 (3)
questions.text: Complete the square:<br=1><equation=-0.1x^2-0.5x-4>

questions.name: Review 4
questions.text: A farmer estimates that if he harvests his potatoes now, he will have 180 bushels at $1.00 per bushel, but if he waits, the crop will increase by 30 bushels per week while the price will drop 10 cents per bushel per week. When should he harvest for the maximum cash return?

questions.name: Review 5
questions.text: Sixty meters of fencing are to be used to enclose a rectangular field and divide it into two parts with a fence parallel to two of the sides. Find the maximum area that can be enclosed.

questions.name: Review 6
questions.text: A set of fenced in areas, as shown in the diagram is being planned on an open field. A total of 900m of fencing is available. What measurement will maximize the overall area of the entire enclosure?<br=1><img=files/math20/quadratic-functions-review/q6.png>

questions.name: Review 7
questions.text: A 50 cm wire is cut so that part of the wire is bent into a square and the other part of the wire is bent into a rectangle where the width is three times the length. Where should the wire be cut so that the combined area of the square and the rectangle is maximized?

questions.name: TextBook Review 1
questions.text: Match the following characteristics with the correct quadratic function:<br=1>a: <equation=y=-5(x-2)^2-3><br=1>b: <equation=y=3(x+3)^2+5><br=1>c: <equation=y=2(x+2)^2-3><br=1>d: <equation=y=3(x-3)^2-5>

questions.text: Classify the function as a quadratic function or a function that is not quadratic.<br=1>a: <equation=y=(x+6)-1><br=1>b: <equation=y=-5(x+1)^2><br=1>c: <equation=y=sqrt((x+2)^2)+7><br=1>d: <equation=y=x^2-8>

questions.name: TextBook Review 4 (1)
questions.text: Identify the vertex, domain, range, axis of symmetry, x-intercepts, and y-intercept for the following quadratic function:<br=1><equation=f(x)=(x+4)^2-3> <br=1><lead=(give intercepts from smallest to greatest)><br=1><lead=(use -inf and inf to represent infinity)>

questions.text: Identify the vertex, domain, range, axis of symmetry, x-intercepts, and y-intercept for the following quadratic function:<br=1><equation=f(x) = -(x- 2)^2+1> <br=1><lead=(give intercepts from smallest to greatest)><br=1><lead=(use -inf and inf to represent infinity)>

questions.name: TextBook Review 4 (3)

questions.name: TextBook Review 6
questions.text: The approximate height, h, in metres, of an arrow shot into the air with an initial velocity of 20 m/s after t seconds can be modelled by the function <equation=h(t) = -5t^2 + 20t + 2>. What is the maximum height reached by the arrow? From what height was the arrow shot? How long did it take for the arrow to hit the ground, to the nearest second?

questions.name: Assignment 2
questions.text: How many x-intercepts does a quadratic function have if the range of the quadratic is (-∞,9] and the domain is (−∞ ,∞)?

questions.name: Assignment 3
questions.text: The graph of the quadratic function <equation=f(x)=(x-p)^2 + q> is shown. What is true about the function <equation=g(x)=-(x-p)^2+q>?<br=2><img=files/math20/assignment/4.png>

answers.text: y = g(x) has the same vertex and range as y = f(x)
y = g(x) has the same vertex as y = f(x) but the range of y=g (x) is (-inf, p]
y = g(x) has the same vertex as y = f(x) but the range of y=g (x) is (-inf, q]
Both the vertex and the range of y = g(x) is different than that of y = f(x)

questions.name: Assignment 10
questions.text: A quadratic function is given by the equation <equation=f(x)=-(x-k)^2-m>. Which of the following is true?

answers.text: The function has a minimum at (-k ,-m)
The function has a maximum at (-k ,-m)
The function has a minimum at (k ,m)
The function has a maximum at (k ,m)

questions.name: Assignment 17
questions.text: Two functions are shown. Both functions have an axis of symmetry of <equation=x=-2> and can be described generally by the quadratic function <equation=y=a(x-p)^2+q>. For the parameters of a, p and q, the functions must:<br=2><img=files/math20/assignment/17.png>

answers.text: Have none of a, p, or q in common.
Have exactly one of a, p, or q in common.
Have exactly two of a, p, or q in common.
Have all three of a, p, or q in common.
